title: 'Misleading': India rejects Navarro's 'Brahmins' remark; calls it 'inaccurate'
content: India has strongly condemned Peter Navarro's remarks about "Brahmins profiting from Russian crude" as inaccurate and misleading. The statement, linking India's oil purchases to funding Russia's war in Ukraine, has sparked widespread criticism across Indian political parties. Even Trump's comments on India's relationship with Russia and China at the SCO summit, adding fuel to the fire.

title: '34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
content: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: Op Sindoor: CDS explains why India used air power; how targets were selected
content: CDS Anil Chauhan stated that India employed air power in Operation Sindoor to dismantle terrorist camps in Bahawalpur and Muridke, as drones and loitering munitions were deemed insufficient to achieve the desired political objectives. This decision followed the Pahalgam terror attack and reflected India's enhanced precision strike capabilities developed after the Balakot operation.

title: 'Highest respect for police force': Ajit Pawar on 'rebuking' women IPS officer
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar faced criticism after a video surfaced showing him allegedly reprimanding a female IPS officer for taking action against illegal soil excavation in Solapur. Pawar clarified that his intention was to maintain calm and not interfere with law enforcement, emphasising his respect for the police force.

title: Trump to tech CEOs: 'Google had a very good day yesterday'; CEO Sundar Pichai replies
content: Donald Trump held a White House dinner for tech leaders. He congratulated Google's Sundar Pichai on winning an antitrust case. Pichai thanked Trump's administration for constructive dialogue. He praised the US AI action plan. Trump incorrectly blamed Joe Biden for the Google lawsuit. Google and Trump are still in legal discussions over YouTube censorship.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad leads, sixth year on top; here’s why
content: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top position in the NIRF management rankings for the sixth consecutive year, maintaining its lead since 2020. The institute consistently excels across key metrics such as teaching, learning and resources, graduation outcomes, and perception. Data from 2016 to 2025 show IIM Ahmedabad’s stable and high performance compared to peer institutions. The 2025 rankings highlight the growing participation of Indian management institutes and the evolving scope of NIRF’s evaluation framework.

title: 'You'll clean it in 2 hours if a dignitary comes': SC raps MCD
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded the MCD for neglecting cleanliness around the "Gumti of Shaikh Ali" monument, questioning their respect for court orders. The court directed the MCD commissioner to hold officers accountable and submit an action plan, emphasizing the need for daily monitoring by a senior official.

title: White House dinner: Melania Trump warns, ‘Our future is no longer science fiction’
content: President Trump convened tech leaders, including Cook, Zuckerberg, and Pichai, to discuss AI's future. Melania Trump emphasized preparing children for an AI-driven world, advocating for its careful guidance. Tech CEOs lauded the administration's AI Action Plan and investments, with Google and Microsoft pledging significant financial contributions to the U.S. economy.

title: Duchess of Kent Katharine, oldest living member of Royal Family, dies at 92
content: The Duchess of Kent, Katharine, passed away peacefully at Kensington Palace on Thursday night at the age of 92. Married to Prince Edward, Duke of Kent, in 1961, she became the oldest living Royal Family member after Queen Elizabeth's death. Remembered for her compassion, especially at Wimbledon, and dedication to music and youth welfare, the Royal Family mourns her loss.

title: Tax underpayment: Angela Rayner quits as UK deputy PM; Starmer sends handwritten letter
content: UK Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner resigned on Friday after an inquiry found she failed to meet ethical standards related to a property purchase. Rayner admitted to underpaying tax on an apartment and expressed deep regret for not seeking specialist tax advice. Prime Minister Keir Starmer accepted her resignation, acknowledging her decision to refer herself to the independent adviser.

title: Rs 60 crore 'cheating case': Lookout circular for Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra
content: Mumbai police have issued a Lookout Circular against Shilpa Shetty and Raj Kundra concerning a Rs 60 crore cheating case. The Economic Offences Wing took this action due to the couple's frequent international travel. The case, registered at Juhu police station, alleges they defrauded a businessman in a loan-cum-investment deal.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.

title: 'Meri kursi na chheen le': Dhoni was 'scared' of Yuvraj Singh — Yograj Singh
content: Yograj Singh, father of Yuvraj Singh, has reignited controversy by accusing Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni of being backstabbers who feared his son's talent. He claimed Sachin Tendulkar was Yuvraj's only true friend, alleging others felt threatened by Yuvraj's potential to usurp their positions in the team. Yograj has previously asserted that Yuvraj was forced into early retirement.

title: 'Took out 67 glass pieces': Met fatal accident, battled cancer - know who she is
content: Mahima Chaudhry, the Bollywood star of the 90s known for hits like 'Pardes,' faced a career-threatening accident when a truck collided with her car, leaving her with severe facial injuries. Fearing its impact on her career, she initially kept the incident private.

title: Trump’s 'high-IQ' tech dinner: Indian-origin CEOs shine; AI and US investments highlighted
content: At a White House dinner hosted by President Trump, five Indian-origin tech executives, including Sundar Pichai and Satya Nadella, were recognized for their significant influence in the US tech sector. These leaders, representing companies like Google, Microsoft, and Micron Technology, highlighted their contributions to AI and innovation.

title: Mid-air scare: AI Express' Delhi-Indore flight issues PAN-PAN call over engine fault
content: An Air India Express flight from Delhi to Indore experienced an engine problem mid-air. The pilot sent a 'PAN-PAN' alert. This signaled a non-critical emergency. The plane landed safely in Indore with a slight delay. Airport authorities took precautions. All 161 passengers and crew are safe. The aircraft landed at Devi Ahilyabai Holkar Airport.

title: Aishwarya & Abhishek shielded Aaradhya from media: Pap reveals more
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Abhishek Bachchan's daughter, Aaradhya, was a subject of immense public curiosity after her birth in 2011. Paparazzo Manav Manglani recounted the frenzy to capture her first photo, revealing the lengths photographers went to, given Aishwarya's initial protectiveness.

title: GST 2.0: Full comprehensive list of items with revised rates
content: New GST rates 2025 full list: The Finance Minister announced significant GST rate cuts and slab changes, effective September 22, 2025, leading to cheaper daily-use items. Many food items will attract 0% GST, and life and health insurance will also see zero tax. The government is monitoring price changes, while luxury and sin goods may face higher taxes, potentially reaching a 40% bracket.

title: Unbelievable! Tickets at Rs 100 - Women's WC sets record with lowest prices in history
content: The ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 is set to break barriers with ticket prices starting at a record low of Rs 100. An exclusive pre-sale window is already open until September 8. Shreya Ghoshal will headline the opening ceremony in Guwahati on September 30, performing the tournament anthem “Bring it Home.

title: From plush to slush: Yamuna floodwaters swamp Noida’s luxury farmhouses
content: Rising Yamuna floodwaters have submerged luxury farmhouses along the Noida floodplain, reviving memories of last year's devastating inundation. Caretakers are evacuating properties as the river approaches record levels, impacting over 1,000 farmhouses with lavish amenities.

title: Watch: Army's daring night evacuation in Ladakh; 2 South Korean nationals rescued
content: The Indian Army swiftly responded to a distress call on September 4th, launching a rescue operation to evacuate two South Korean nationals stranded at the Kongmarula Pass in Ladakh. Helicopters were deployed within 15 minutes of receiving the request, successfully airlifting the individuals from the high-altitude location around 9:15 pm.

title: NIRF rankings 2025: Hindu, Miranda House remain best two colleges of India
content: Delhi University (DU) continues its dominance in the NIRF 2025 rankings, securing top positions with 32 colleges on the list. Hindu College and Miranda House retain their top spots, while DU achieves its best-ever fifth position among universities. Other Delhi institutions like JNU and Jamia Millia Islamia also shine, with AIIMS Delhi leading in medical and dental categories.

title: Who is Karol G? Colombian superstar shines; chiefs vs chargers halftime show
content: The National Football League's 2025 season expands to Brazil. Sao Paulo will host a game between Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Chargers. Colombian singer Karol G will perform at the halftime show. The performance will stream live on YouTube. Ana Castela will sing the Brazilian national anthem. Kamasi Washington will deliver the U.S. anthem.

title: US Open: 'Goldfish' Amanda Anisimova goes from rock bottom to cusp of success
content: Amanda Anisimova has learned to forget, reset, and fight again. Just 54 days after her crushing 0-6, 0-6 Wimbledon final loss, the 24-year-old American is back on the biggest stage — this time at the US Open. With belief, grit, and booming winners, she now stands one match away from her first Grand Slam crown, just 61 miles from where she was born.

title: 'Locked himself in bathroom': This actor recalls school bullying; shares story
content: Hrithik Roshan, celebrated for his acting, dance, and looks, overcame a difficult childhood marked by stuttering and a spinal problem that doctors said would prevent him from becoming an actor. He faced immense challenges, including locking himself in a bathroom to practice speaking without stammering.

title: ‘Will be legitimate targets’: Vladimir Putin warns of direct attacks in Ukraine
content: President Putin warned that any Western troops deployed to Ukraine would be considered legitimate targets, following pledges of postwar security guarantees including an international force. He argued such deployments wouldn't ensure lasting peace, citing growing military ties as a conflict root cause. Macron criticized Russia's troop movements despite ceasefire talks. Recent large-scale Russian attacks targeted Western Ukraine.

title: Maharashtra minister becomes 1st Tesla owner: Pratak Sarnaik takes 'Y' model home
content: Maharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik received the first Tesla Model Y in Mumbai, aiming to promote electric vehicle adoption. He intends to gift the car to his grandson, fostering early awareness of green mobility. Maharashtra is committed to EV transition with incentives and MSRTC's procurement of 5,000 e-buses, aligning with the Prime Minister's clean mobility vision.

title: ‘Illegitimate targeting’: US puts sanctions on Palestinian rights groups
content: The U.S. sanctioned three Palestinian human rights organizations for allegedly instigating the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation into Israel, according to the Treasury Department. Secretary Rubio stated the groups targeted Israeli nationals without consent, prompting the action. The ICC's later arrest warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders over war crimes allegations further fueled the controversy.

title: Exclusive | From Rs 1 coins to defeating Divya Deshmukh: Abhimanyu Puranik’s journey
content: Divya Deshmukh, after her Women's World Cup victory, revealed her mentors, Csaba Balogh and Abhimanyu Puranik. At the Grand Swiss 2025, Puranik, who had just enjoyed a Disneyland vacation, defeated his protégé, Divya. Puranik, a Mumbai-born Punekar, started chess at five and praised Divya's amazing mentality and potential for future dominance in Indian chess.

title: Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather: Fight date set; latest details out
content: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. are set to clash in an exhibition match in Spring 2026, confirmed by CSI Sports/Fight Sports. The highly anticipated event pits Tyson's aggressive style against Mayweather's defensive prowess. Both fighters have expressed excitement and surprise, promising a legendary showdown for fans worldwide, though the specific date and venue remain undisclosed.

title: Clash over 'samosas': UP man thrashed with kicks and punches by wife, in-laws
content: In Pilibhit, a domestic dispute over samosas turned violent when Shivam Kumar failed to bring them home as requested by his wife, Sangeeta. The argument escalated the next day, leading to Sangeeta, along with her parents and uncle, allegedly assaulting Shivam. Police have registered an FIR, and an investigation is underway to determine the full scope of the incident.

title: Messi not playing WC 2026? He says: 'It's only logical to think I might not'
content: Lionel Messi is uncertain about participating in the 2026 World Cup to defend Argentina's title, citing his age and physical condition as key factors. After scoring twice in a 3-0 victory against Venezuela, the 38-year-old stated he will assess his fitness and performance throughout the upcoming season before making a final decision.

title: 'Bidi-Bihar' row: Deleted Cong post on GST sparks backlash; BJP hits back
content: A social media post by the Kerala Congress linking GST reforms to Bihar has ignited a political firestorm. The now-deleted post, referencing reduced taxes on bidis, was slammed by BJP and JD(U) leaders as an insult to the state and its people. The controversy has intensified ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, with the BJP-JD(U) alliance using it to attack Congress.

title: 'Phone call' halts mining crackdown: Trouble for Ajit Pawar over ‘threat’ to cop?
content: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar faces accusations of obstructing IPS officer Anjana Krishna's efforts to curb illegal sand mining in Solapur. A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

title: Joe Biden undergoes skin cancer surgery, fresh videos show head wound - watch
content: Ex-US President, Joe Biden, was recently spotted with a visible mark on his head. Reports confirm that the 82-year-old underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Biden was seen leaving a church in Rehoboth Beach with a bandage. Earlier, he was seen wearing a cap to conceal the wound. In May, aides disclosed Biden's diagnosis of Stage 4 prostate cancer. Biden shared a message about strength in difficult times.

title: ‘Will restore Amma’s rule’: Sasikala rakes up AIADMK unity debate; signals political comeback
content: VK Sasikala has reignited the AIADMK leadership debate, asserting the party's need for unity to challenge the DMK in the 2026 elections. Senior leader K A Sengottaiyan supports Sasikala, urging EPS to reconcile with former members.

title: NIRF 2025: IIM Ahmedabad ranks first again in management, check top 10 here
content: IIM Ahmedabad has secured the top spot in the NIRF 2025 management institute rankings for the sixth consecutive year. IIM Bangalore and IIM Kozhikode follow closely behind. While IIMs dominate, non-IIMs like IIT Delhi's DMS, MDI Gurgaon, and XLRI Jamshedpur also feature in the top 10, showcasing a diverse range of quality management education options in India.

title: Who is Mitesh Khapra? The IIT Madras professor featured in TIME Magazine
content: Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras professor, features in TIME's 2025 AI 100 list. He is recognised for NLP and machine learning contributions. Khapra focuses on AI systems for India's diverse languages. His work addresses challenges in English-centric AI models. He aims to make AI accessible across India. AI4Bharat, his project, builds datasets for Indian languages. This initiative supports government's Bhashini mission.

title: Is it a bank holiday on September 5? Check details
content: Banks across multiple Indian states remained closed on September 5 due to Id-E-Milad and Thiruvonam, as per the RBI holiday calendar. While digital banking services continued uninterrupted, physical branch visits were necessary for certain transactions. Maharashtra, however, shifted the Eid-e-Milad holiday in Mumbai to September 8, 2025, impacting government securities and related markets.

title: Tim Cook, Sundar Pichai and more: Trump hosts White House dinner; Musk absent
content: US president Trump hosted tech leaders, including Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerberg, at the White House to discuss AI and US investments. The meeting highlighted the growing influence of Indian-American executives in Silicon Valley. Trump downplayed jobs data, mentioned speaking with Putin, and Google's CEO expressed relief over the antitrust case's end.

title: 'Department of war': Why Trump wants to rename Pentagon; executive order likely today
content: President Trump is set to sign an executive order allowing the Pentagon to be referred to as the "Department of War," a secondary designation endorsed by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. Trump hinted at the change, recalling the department's historical name during World Wars. This move follows Hegseth's actions to reverse earlier policies, including reattributing Confederate-era fort names.

title: 5th death in 10 months: BITS Pilani Goa student found dead on campus
content: Rishi Nair, a 19-year-old BITS Pilani Goa student from Bengaluru, was found dead in his hostel room, marking the fifth student death in ten months. Police report Rishi was battling depression following his girlfriend's suicide. His parents had moved him to the Goa campus for support.

title: World No. 5 GM Muzychuk forgets about clock, suffers massive setback at Grand Swiss
content: The FIDE Grand Swiss witnessed a stunning upset as Hungarian teenager Zsóka Gaál defeated world No. 5 Anna Muzychuk. Reigning world champion D Gukesh of India began strongly, defeating Etienne Bacrot, while Praggnanandhaa drew with Jeffery Xiong. In other matches, Vaishali secured a win, adding to the excitement of the tournament's opening day.

title: Series of earthquakes hit Afghanistan days after quake killed over 2,000
content: A series of earthquakes, including a 5.2 magnitude tremor, have struck Afghanistan's Hindukush region, causing widespread devastation. The quakes have resulted in over 2,200 fatalities and 3,000 injuries, exacerbating an already dire humanitarian situation worsened by recent flash floods. International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

title: Dramatic arrest in Kannauj: SP leader Kaish Khan found hiding in mattress
content: Kaish Khan, a Samajwadi Party leader and former treasurer, was apprehended in Kannauj for violating a banishment order. Authorities had instructed Khan to remain outside the district limits on July 28. Acting on a tip, Kotwali police discovered him concealed in the loft of his residence.

title: Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Built a $10 billion fashion empire
content: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: Himanta Sarma Orders Satellite Mapping Of Open Drains After 3-Year-Old's Death
content: In a significant move, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has instructed the state's Chief Secretary to employ satellite imagery to identify open drains across urban areas throughout the state.

title: US Added Just 22,000 Jobs Last Month Amid Donald Trump's Uncertain Economic Policies
content: US employers added just 22,000 jobs last month as the labor market continued to cool under uncertainty over President Donald Trump's economic policies.

title: Duchess Of Kent, Oldest Member Of British Royal Family, Dies At 92
content: TheDuchessofKent, who famously broke royal protocoltohug aWimbledonrunner-upandstepped away from family dutiestoteachmusicin a public school, has died, Buckingham Palace announced Friday. She was92.

title: Apple's India Sales Skyrocket To Record $9 Billion After Big Retail Push
content: Apple Inc.'s annual sales in India hit a record of nearly $9 billion in the last fiscal year, signalling growing consumer demand for its flagship devices as the company ramps up its retail footprint in the world's most populous country.

title: Indian YouTuber Loses Phone At Dubai Airport, Police Sends It Back To Chennai
content: The Dubai police arranged for the device to be sent back to Chennai free of cost on the next available flight.

title: Will Lalu Yadav's RJD Tighten Hold On Bihar Muslim Votes. What Numbers Say
content: As political parties in Bihar work overtime to win over voters for the upcoming Assembly polls, a big question is who will manage to corner the Muslim minority vote in Bihar.Muslims account for about 17 per cent of Bihar's population

title: At least 5 Maoists Gunned Down By Security Forces In Chhattisgarh
content: The red corridor of Chhattisgarh once again shook with gunfire on Friday as security forces clashed with Maoists deep inside the dense forests of Abujhmad, straddling the Dantewada-Narayanpur border.

title: Ahmedabad Airport Unveils Integrated Cargo Terminal To Boost Gujarat's Export Logistics
content: Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International (SVPI) Airport has inaugurated an Integrated Cargo Terminal (ICT), significantly boosting its cargo handling capacity.

title: 'Intention Wasn't To Interfere But...': Ajit Pawar On Viral Woman IPS Video
content: Following a huge controversy over him "threatening" a woman police officer who was cracking down on illegal excavation in Maharashtra's Solapur, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar has said he was only trying to prevent an escalation in the situation.

title: US Detains Hundreds Of South Koreans In Factory Immigration Raid
content: Hundreds of South Koreans were detained during a major US immigration raid on a Hyundai-LG battery plant being built in the state of Georgia, prompting Seoul to urge Washington Friday to respect its citizens' rights.

title: After National Health Commission Sacks 25 Workers, 14,000 Employees Resign
content: Over 14,000 striking contractual officers and employees of the National Health Mission in Chhattisgarh have submitted their resignations after the government sacked 25 NHM staffers leading the agitation, one of their representatives said on Friday.

title: Video: Trump Teases Zuckerberg About His "Political Career", Gets Swift Rejection
content: US President Donald Trump joked with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg at the White House dinner with tech leaders, saying that this would be the beginning of his "political career", to which the tech founder quickly said, "No, it's not".

title: Assam Firm Director, 2 Others Arrested For Boy's Death After Falling In Drain
content: The director of a private firm and two of its employees were arrested for alleged negligence at its under-construction flyover site in Guwahati, where a 3-year-old boy died.

title: Army Rescues 2 South Korean Mountaineers In Ladakh; 1 Dies
content: The Indian Army rescued two critically ill South Korean nationals during a trekking expedition from a peak in the Union territory of Ladakh, officials said on Friday. However, one of the climbers passed away during treatment.

title: NDTV Campaign: Bhagwant Mann, Sonu Sood Step In To Help Boy With Kidney Disorder
content: Less than 24 hours after NDTV began a campaign to help an eight-year-old with a kidney ailment whose village has been affected by the floods in Punjab, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann and Bollywood actor Sonu Sood have assured the family of aid.

title: Tesla's Proposed Pay Package Could Make Elon Musk World's 1st Trillionaire
content: Tesla has announced a compensation plan for Elon Musk that links massive stock rewards to ambitious corporate goals.

title: "Pre-Festival Gift": Experts Welcome GST Reduction On Small Cars, Bikes
content: The GST Council's decision to reduce the Goods and Services Tax on small cars and motorcycles up to 350 cc has brought a wave of happiness among the automobile and auto component industry, industry experts said.

title: "Inaccurate, Misleading": India On Trump Adviser Peter Navarro's Recent Remarks
content: Official Spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs Randhir Jaiswal clarified that India rejects the "inaccurate and misleading" comments made by US President Donald Trump's senior trade advisor Peter Navarro.

title: Man Injured, 5 Parked Vehicles Damaged As Wall Collapses In Delhi's Greater Kailash
content: A section of a wall collapsed in south Delhi's Greater Kailash-1 on Friday, injuring a driver and damaging parked vehicles, an official said.

title: New Helicopter For Chandrababu Naidu To Enhance Security, Cut Travel Time
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Nara Chandrababu Naidu has started using a new, high-tech helicopter, the Airbus H-160, for his official tours.

title: Carter sorry for spitting on Prescott: 'A mistake'
content: Eagles defensive tackle Jalen Carter was ejected from Thursday night's season-opening win before the first play from scrimmage for spitting on Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott.

title: 'Disappointed' Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Umps take Trammell's bat after Yankees appeal
content: The ninth inning of the Yankees' 8-4 win over the Astros on Thursday night was delayed after umpires confiscated a bat used by Astros outfielder Taylor Trammell.

title: Ballmer: Clips 'always done right thing' with Kawhi
content: Clippers owner Steve Ballmer told ESPN that he would "want the league to investigate" if another owner and another team were accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap, as the Clippers were in a podcast by Pablo Torre on Wednesday.

title: 49ers add McCaffrey to injury report with calf issue
content: Running back Christian McCaffrey was added to the San Francisco 49ers' injury report Thursday night because of a calf issue.

title: Sources: North Carolina, Belichick ban Pats staff
content: North Carolina and first-year head coach Bill Belichick have banned the New England Patriots' staff from accessing the Tar Heels' program, sources told ESPN.

title: Tyson, Mayweather Jr. to compete in exhibition
content: Boxing legends Mike Tyson and Floyd Mayweather Jr. agreed to compete in an exhibition boxing match next spring, with details to be determined at a later date.

title: Connelly: 28 games that could make Week 2 very interesting
content: Get set for two big brands trying to look the part in a unique helmet game, some big tests for Big Ten hopefuls and the Group of 5's biggest weekend.

title: Alcaraz vs. Djokovic at the US Open: How each can win
content: Can Djokovic find a way to get past Alcaraz in the US Open semifinals? Djokovic has the better record -- but Alcaraz has momentum on his side.

title: Caitlin Clark’s season is over: What comes next for the Fever star?
content: The Fever continue their playoff chase without Caitlin Clark, who was ruled out for the rest of the season Thursday.

title: Expectations are high for Saints' Kellen Moore: 'I always wanted to be a football coach'
content: The youngest active head coach at 37, the former NFL quarterback aims to get New Orleans back to the postseason.

title: From No. 1 to ... the Rockies, again: Ranking all 30 MLB cores
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: 'He changed for the better of the game': How Jim Harbaugh has evolved as Chargers coach
content: From San Francisco to Ann Arbor to Los Angeles, Jim Harbaugh's coaching style has changed through the years.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: 30 years later, remembering Ripken's record-setting streak
content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

title: Why Michigan has already rallied behind Bryce Underwood
content: With comparisons to Trevor Lawrence ahead of an early test against Oklahoma, the lore around the nation's No. 1 freshman is growing.

title: To call plays or not to call plays ... that's the question for many top head coaches
content: Coaches like Mike Norvell and Ryan Day were known for calling plays. If they need or want to stop, things get interesting.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: Key matchups, fantasy intel and predictions for Week 1's remaining 15 games
content: Here's everything you need to know for Week 1 NFL games. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: What are the odds? Top 25 predicted anytime NFL TD scorers for Week 1
content: Mike Clay's reveals his top 25 predicted touchdown scorers for Week 1, comparing implied odds to ESPN BET's.

title: College football best bets: Why to take the over for Cyclones-Hawkeyes
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 2, including a look at the Iowa State-Iowa game.

title: 'Hell, no. I can't be that fourth': What Carmelo Anthony did -- and didn't do -- to land in Springfield
content: Nineteen seasons, six teams, three gold medals and 28,289 points: Here's why Melo's career will forever be known for far more than just a Hall of Fame résumé.

title: NCAA, NHL rule change reactions, Schaefer ready for Islanders
content: The incoming first-year class offered its take on several significant topics ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: 'I got one more ring from it': Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: Rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: Top prospects at every position
content: Who are the best players at every position? Our analysts give their top-fives, plus their combined overall top-10 ranking for the 2026 class.

title: Idaho's 'Fightin' Taters' alternate helmets headline best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: The distinctive design will be paired with a sleek all-black uniform and pays homage to Idaho's deep connection to the potato industry.

title: Chargers powder blue, Chiefs' traditional look in Brazil top NFL Week 1 threads
content: Here's a look at the Week 1 uniforms for all 32 NFL teams, led by the Saints debuting their gold uniforms.

title: 50 most expensive transfers of summer window, ranked by true cost: Isak isn't No. 1
content: There's how much a transfer costs, and then there's what a club can afford to pay. We've ranked the *actual* 50 most expensive transfers of the 2025 summer window.

title: Pochettino, Pulisic must reconcile for USMNT to be at its best
content: Ahead of next summer's World Cup on home soil, it will be important for USMNT manager Mauricio Pochettino and star player Christian Pulisic to rebuild their relationship.

title: CM welcomes revamped GST rates, but says the benefits should reach common man
content: If the benefits fail to reach the common man, the blame will rest squarely on the Union government: Siddaramaiah

title: Recent recusals in Supreme Court, HC, tribunal send mixed signals on transparency
content: No formal rules govern recusals by judges; SC judge M.M. Sundresh recently exited bail plea case  without providing any reason; bucking the trend, NCLAT judge, M.P. HC judge opted for transparency

title: Five workers missing after water release from dam floods Gujarat hydropower plant
content: The police say there were 15 workers on maintenance duty inside a 60-ft deep well in the plant when water was released from the Kadana dam upstream. While 10 of them managed to escape, five people are yet to be traced.

title: EAGLE chief warns students against drug use
content: He highlights cases of students caught in drug-related offences and urges youth to stay vigilant and report peddlers via WhatsApp

title: Jaishankar to join Brazil-led BRICS virtual summit on Trump tariffs: MEA
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend summit called by Brazil President Lula; the meet is likely to irk Washington that views the BRICS as “anti-American”

title: Himachal CM slams BJP leaders for not helping disaster-hit residents
content: Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu says State government has requested Centre to provide ‘one bigha’ of forest land to each affected family to help them resettle in safer locations

title: Kuppam police take action against false social media posts on Krishna waters
content: Officials say HNSS canals are supplying water as scheduled, dismissing disruption reports as baseless

title: Modi government has made a mockery of MGNREGA by chronically underfunding it: Jairam Ramesh
content: On the 20th anniversary of MGNREGA, the Congress general secretary says the scheme has been underfunded for the last 11 years and the budget has not been hiked for the last three years despite high inflation. This latest crisis is not an aberration but a reflection of a larger attempt by the government to throttle the scheme, he says

title: IT Minister Lokesh seeks Prime Minister Modi’s support for development of Andhra Pradesh
content: Expressing gratitude for approving an ASIP semiconductor unit in the State, he seeks the Centre’s help in tapping the potential of IT, Electronics and Communications sector

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. denies purchasing new helicopter for Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: With the security agencies flagging concerns over the existing one developing technical glitches often, an advanced Airbus H160 helicopter has been taken on lease to not only cut travel time but also save costs, say CMO officials

title: India unveils roadmap to strengthen nuclear deterrence, drone warfare capabilities
content: The document titled Technology Perspective and Capability Roadmap (TPCR-2025), a 15-year blueprint for military preparedness, highlights measures to ensure credible nuclear deterrence

title: Ahead of Monza, why Mercedes is keeping faith in Antonelli
content: Kimi Antonelli is the 18-year-old next big thing of Formula 1, and ahead of his return to Monza, he will continue to prove that at Mercedes.

title: Congress is ‘home of fake Gandhis’, says BJP A.P. president
content: Calling for regular forums that enable leaders to understand public opinion and shape better policies, P.V.N. Madhav says, every problem has a solution when people and leaders discuss it together

title: ‘Super Six’ promises a big hit with people, says Excise Minister
content: Kollu Ravindra highlights key welfare schemes and achievements of the coalition government within its first year in office

title: Agriculture Minister asks Collectors to closely monitor urea supply, availability and distribution
content: Atchannaidu also instructs officials to divert stocks from the surplus areas to the regions facing shortage

title: 76-year-old army veteran from Bengaluru completes Arctic expedition and Polar Plunge
content: The Army veteran commenced the expedition from Longyearbyen in Norway on the ship, Polar Quest, along with a group of 48 people, on August 22

title: Commissioners of newly formed city corporations carry out inspections
content: Commissioners instructed officials to maintain cleanliness along the drains, repair damaged footpaths, take mosquito control measures, among other issues

title: NRI couple brings to light plight of a tribal hamlet in Nellore
content: A resident says due to the lack of proper roads, children are struggling to get to school; despite several requests to the Electricity Department, the power supply has not been provided and we are going to the houses of a neighbouring colony to charge our mobile phones

title: 47% Ministers in India face criminal cases, finds report
content: The Association for Democratic Reforms examined self-sworn affidavits of 643 Ministers from 27 State Assemblies, three Union Territories, and the Union Council of Ministers

title: Forum demands govt. medical colleges in Vijayapura
content: It has passed a resolution opposing the PPP model and demanded that the State govt. fully fund and operate the new government medical college in the district

title: Aakash to offer scholarships worth ₹250 cr.; to conduct national talent hunt exam from Oct. 4
content: Registrations have been opened for the exam, and the interested candidates can apply online or visit the nearest Akash Institute centre in their city

title: KLETU secures position in NIRF for 3rd successive year
content: According to KLETU, it has been placed in the Rank Band of 151-200 in the Engineering stream under India Rankings 2025

title: PMK town panchayat chairman survives attempt on life in Thanjavur district, party cadres stage protest
content: The assailants threw explosives at office where town panchayat president M.K. Stalin was talking to some persons; he locked himself up in a room while two others were injured

title: Assamese film Goodbye Guruji selected for Paris festival
content: Writer-director Arunjit Borah’s movie is a story of transformation through education and perseverance

title: Kavitha’s episode to divert attention from Kaleshwaram project probe: Telangana Congress chief Mahesh
content: TPCC chief said he won’t comment on the possibility of MLC Kavitha joining Congress without AICC approval. He completes one year as the PCC chief on Saturday

title: Chhattisgarh: 14,000 contractual staffers of National Health Mission quit as government sacks 25 agitators
content: 10-point demands include the creation of a public health cadre, grade pay, and compassionate appointments

title: Tom Vattakuzhy talks art, loneliness, and why his painting is not a placard
content: Set in domestic spaces, the Kerala-based artist’s work “does not depict a specific event” but is a “provocation to think“

title: Param Sundari and Bollywood stereotypes of Kerala
content: Kerala representation, Malayalam mispronunciation and Janhvi Kapoor’s character reignite the authenticity debate in Bollywood

title: Andhra Minister Nara Lokesh meets PM Modi; seeks support for development of Andhra Pradesh
content: Nara Lokesh requested PM Modi to extend all possible support to the Andhra Pradesh Government in attracting investments, and expressed gratitude for approving the establishment of a semiconductor unit in the State

title: Nation stands with people affected by natural calamities during monsoon: President Murmu
content: The nation shares the sorrow of the people affected by calamities and is with them in this crisis, Ms. Murmu added

title: IRCTC to run Bhavya Gujarat package tour
content: The tour covers Dwarakadish temple in Dwaraka, Nageshwar temple, Bet Dwaraka, Somnath temple, Sabarmati Ashram, Mothera sun temple, Rani ki Vav and finally conclude with the Statue of Unity (Sardar Patel statue) at Ekta Nagar

title: Govt. will ensure benefit of GST reductions is passed on to consumers: Piyush Goyal
content: The Union Minister of Commerce and Industry called for a collective effort, and said all sections of the industry had given the assurance that the benefit of substantial reductions would be passed on to consumers

title: Mud wall collapses; three including two children killed in West Bengal
content: The family was in process to make a house under the Banglar Bari Scheme of the West Bengal Government. Funds under the PM Awas Yojana have remained suspended in the State in 2021

title: Modi govt must introduce law for implementing Article 15(5) in Parliament's Winter session: Congress
content: BJP are stealing both the right to vote and reservation. This is a conspiracy, under which government educational institutions are being gradually closed first, and then the entire education system is being handed over to private hands, says Adivasi Congress chief Vikrant Bhuria

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu emphasises need for adopting new technology, ADR mechanisms to make justice more accessible
content: Chandrababu Naidu also noted that earlier, there was a stigma associated with approaching the courts, but that has changed significantly now

title: President Murmu honours 45 teachers with National Teacher Awards
content: From novel methods of teaching, dedication to students' growth to attempts to enhance learning achievements in difficult environments, the awardees were recognised at the annual award ceremony

title: T.N. cyber crime police warn of two new frauds
content: The police have issued an advisory asking the people to check traffic fines only on official government websites or verified apps

title: Kashmir’s 360 degree view from top: Lake by lake, meadow by meadow
content: Over 50 high altitude lakes, many rarely-travelled, are now depicted pictorially in Mahmood A Shah’s coffee table book Valleys of Jammu & Kashmir

title: Mumbai police launch investigation after receiving message threatening to ‘blow up’ city
content: Police officials denied media reports that an organisation had claimed the responsibility of the threat messages

title: HRD Minister Nara Lokesh slams YSR Congress Party for portraying teachers in bad light
content: Nara Lokesh also appealed to teachers to understand and appropriately respond to the false propaganda being spread through fake handles by the YSRCP

title: Will approach Supreme Court against ‘injustice’: Kapil Sibal on Delhi High Court rejecting Umar Khalid bail plea
content: The Rajya Sabha MP also questioned as to where India’s democracy was heading with political parties not raising such issues thinking that this may harm them politically

title: O. Panneerselvam, Sasikala, BJP welcome Sengottaiyan’s call for unity among AIADMK factions
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami cancels his scheduled interaction with farmers in Theni; Sasikala extends support to Sengottaiyan

title: US Open rescue pup wins over Sabalenka, finds home with Muhammad

title: LeBron, Kobe and the scars that led to Redeem Team gold in 2008

title: A desire to be a global brand: Why Chiefs have embraced Brazil
content: dozens of fans arrived hours before the Chiefs walked through the terminal to greet and touch several members of their favorite team . the crowd cheered, recorded videos and chanted the last names of quarterback Patrick Mahomes and tight end Travis Kelce . a number of fans held signs for the star players and rookies alike .

title: Solak predicts stat leaders: No. 1 candidates in five categories
content: there are plenty of markets for season leaders in all sorts of statistical categories . there are markets for leaders in passing yards, rushing yards and receiving yards . the touchdown categories get very noisy, but there are historical trends we can look at .

title: 🏈 Fantasy Football: Lawrence, Young top QBs?
content: fantasy football managers must decide what to believe and what not to believe moving forward . nine quarterbacks who went no. 1 are scheduled to start this week . the only matchup with more than one is the Jacksonville Jaguars home game versus the Carolina Panthers .

title: Banner day for Eagles as champs hold off Cowboys in wild one

title: Anisimova wins, sets up Open final vs. Sabalenka
content: aryna Sabalenka beats Naomi Osaka 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 in a thrilling semifinal . the eighth-seeded beats anisimova 6-7 (4), 7-6 (3) 6-3 . she will face no. 1 sarah mcdonald in the final of her second grand Slam .

title: 'There's a lot of hate:' These games define the Mizzou-Kansas rivalry
content: the second home game of the season will go to a commercial break before the fourth quarter begins . it has become customary that the Mizzou fans in attendance will lob F-bombs in unison at their biggest rival . the rivalry resumed in 2021, with Kansas winning the first three games .
